abstract: Editorial cites case of John MacKenzie, who has repeatedly been denied parole despite model behavior during his 40 years in prison, as example of how New York State Parole Board routinely ignores requirements that it take into account inmates' rehabilitation; notes state courts have held board in contempt twice and Gov Andrew Cuomo has proposed measures to reform parole process.

headline.print_headline: A Challenge to New York’s Broken Parole Board
headline.main: A Challenge to New York’s Broken Parole Board

snippet: A state court has held the board in contempt for refusing to follow the law and give a meaningful chance of release to an obviously qualified inmate.
lead_paragraph: A state court has held the board in contempt for refusing to follow the law and give a meaningful chance of release to an obviously qualified inmate.
